title: World shares rebound, try to shake off U.S. tech rout scare

title: Central Bank Dilemma: Tie Between Money And Inflation Appears Broken
text: Inflation targeting has been a mainstay of central bank policy making for several decades now. Reliance on the results of the Phillips Curve continues to dominate policy models.

title: What's Next For The U.S. Economy: Robert Reich
text: In honor of Labor Day, our latest interview with former Secretary of Labor Robert Reich reviews how the federal government should support the new virtual economy as we battle the coronavirus pandemic. He says the economy won't fully recover until there is a vaccine and that President Trump's first term in office will not leave behind any kind of economic legacy. Watch the video to see why he thinks a universal basic income will offer more economic reliability and why we need a revival of the CARES Act.
